content:
Hello again.

May I share some tips for getting help on this forum?

  • Clearly communicate the facts of a problem.
  • Report one problem per thread.
  • Do not rant. And do not repeat rants.

Not following these tips makes people reluctant to help and it makes solving problems more difficult. I am spending much more time than I want to spend reading through repeated rants in several messages to try to pull out the information that is actually useful for solving your problems. So would you please just report facts and try to answer questions directly and completely?

Now, after twelve messages in this thread, I believe I understand that you have three problems:

  1. When Thunderbird tries to retrieve new messages, you see a message that the connection to the server timed out. This happens all the time and you never receive new messages.
  2. A window appears asking you to sign in to Yahoo.
  3. New messages in Thunderbird go to the trash folder instead of the in-box.

Is my understanding correct?

Also, your outgoing (SMTP) servers have some oddities, but, if are able to send messages, as you say you are, the oddities are not important. But you should be able to delete two of the servers if you are not using them, and you should put a description on the server that you are using.

PROBLEM #1: When does this error occur? Every time that Thunderbird tries to retrieve messages? There are many reasons for connection time-outs. I am no expert on them. One cause is a bad network. How well is your network performing? But I assume that this symptom is related to Problem #2.

PROBLEM #2: When does this window appear? What happens when you sign in to Yahoo?

PROBLEM #3: Do you access this account from any other app, webmail, computer, or your phone?

Can you access this account through webmail? Do sending and receiving work normally there?

Are you using anti-virus software, including the one provided with Windows, or other security software?

Is storing cookies in Thunderbird enabled? See general settings > privacy & security > Web settings.

Edits: fixed typos.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Hi Tony,

In a message that is not posted here yet, you wrote:

“VERY URGENT PLEASE 06-14-2025 12_10 PM...! Hi Rick: ...I've just completed my 'Post Reply' to you a minute ago but when I was just adding last notes - my draft has just disappeared by the Yahoo constantly interfering with my writing(!): once in awhile it just re-appear - can you just quickly search for it, it must be still in Mozilla/Thunderbird Website somewhere, I'm still searching for it too - please let me know by your immediate message about it here ...thanks-Tony H.“

You seem to have a misunderstanding of what Thunderbird is and how it works and how this forum works. Your e-mail messages are never stored on any Thunderbird or Mozilla site. They are stored on the Yahoo servers and on your devices. No one here can access any e-mail account or messages of yours. Moreover, we are all users supporting each other. I have no authority from Mozilla.

I explain all this partly because it may help with what you perceive as a problem with Yahoo and what you call interference. You need Thunderbird and Yahoo to connect. A message from Yahoo that appears in Thunderbird is probably not a bad thing. It is probably a required thing.

But there is no reason why Yahoo would have anything to do with your posting messages here and it is very unlikely that they do.

And there is no place for draft messages to be saved here, so looking for what you lost will not help.

So please try again. Make sure that you are replying on this site, not in Thunderbird or in Yahoo webmail.

content:
Hi Tony,

Your ranting and the blaming are still making my work harder than it should be. I will not keep expending this effort indefinitely.

Other people use Thunderbird to access accounts hosted by Yahoo just fine and you should be able to also.

You did not answer perhaps the most imrportant questions: When does this window (the one about signing in to Yahoo) appear? What happens when you sign in to Yahoo?

Would you please answer?

It is possible that some of your problems would be fixed simply by signing in to Yahoo. My impression is that you perceive that window to be some kind of nefarious interference from Yahoo, so I'm guessing that you don't sign in. However, as I said before, Thunderbird needs access to Yahoo.

I asked: "Do you access this account from any other app, webmail, computer, or your phone?"

To explain: You have an e-mail account through Frontier.com that is hosted on Yahoo's servers. There are many ways to access that Frontier.com e-mail account and send messages from it and receive messages at it. One way is Thunderbird. Another way is another e-mail client application on your computer such as Outlook or another e-mail client application on your phone, including Thunderbird, if you use an Android phone. Another way is to log in to your account at Frontier.com from a Web browser and manage your e-mail through the browser. This last option is called webmail.

Do you access your Frontier.com e-mail account in any of these other ways?

I also asked: "Can you access this account through webmail? Do sending and receiving work normally there?"

Please log in to your Frontier.com account in a browser window, send an e-mail message to yourself, and see if it is sent and received.

content:
Hi Tony,

In response to a message that has not been published here yet ...

I already explained why I asked you to stop ranting.

I have not provided specific suggestions to fix your problems because I am still trying to understand your problems. A problem has to be understood and diagnosed before it can be solved. You have presented three problems in difficult to understand language. I cannot simply tell you how to fix all of them.

You did not answer my question about what happens when you sign in to Yahoo. Your repeated mention of Yahoo not offering the user of Thunderbird, whatever that means, suggests that you have misunderstood my question and that you may misunderstand the relationship between Thunderbird and Yahoo. I am talking about signing in to Yahoo when you that window appears. I'm not talking about signing in to webmail, if that's what you are thinking.

As I said twice already, Thunderbird works fine with Yahoo servers.

I did indeed answer your question about what I meant about accessing your account from other apps.

I am not ignoring what you are saying about Yahoo servers. I have even done research on them to try to figure out what the problem is. But I don't know what the issues are, and you have not told me in terms that make any sense to me. You just assume that I (and "everyone") know about some long-standing problem. The only problem I have been able to find on my own is that keeping a stored password for Yahoo in Thunderbird after Yahoo switched to Oauth for authorization may cause problems. So you might go into general settings > privacy & security > passwords > saved passwords and delete your Yahoo password.

(I also verified your server settings. They are correct. So they should not be the source of any problems.)

I don't know why your messages are going to trash instead of your in-box. I asked you to do a test at frontier.com to help us figure that out. Apparently, you did not do it.

I'm done trying to help. Good luck, Tony.
creator: mozilla98

content: Yes, it's the best way. On Win, the folder you're copying/pasting is C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird, and I recommend deleting that folder on the target drive before pasting (vs. overwriting it).

content:
Uninstall reinstall is a complete waste of time in this instance as it will not fix the server issuing an invalid certificate. Perhaps you could advise that that server name is. The images are so microscopic that I can not read them. With the server name I could check the certificate that they send when contacted to look for a clue as to why it is invalid.

You need to determine why you are being offered an invalid certificate by the server.

If it is a hosted domain it may be the certificated is not valid because it has the hosts name on it, not your domain. If you have an antivirus scanning incoming mail, it could be that the antivirus is issuing a self signed certificate that is not valid without you undertaking a manual addition of the antivirus vendor as a trusted certifying authority for encryption.

I suggest you have a look in the error console(ctrl+shift+J) and see what messages appear there at the same time as that dialog appears. That might shed some additional light as to what the real problem is.
creator: MattAuSupport

Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)

content: This is more an HTML question. The border attribute in the advanced editor sets the width of the border. To set the color, you need to manually add HTML tag for that, and to do that you need to have an HTML editor addon such as this one: https://betterbird.eu/addons/

content: I faced the same issue while enhancing email visuals. Instead of using the "border" attribute, try inline CSS like style="border: 6px solid red"—it works perfectly. And that's it - - no "proceed anyway" option, only options that come up with the ellipsis have to do with whether or not windows displays notifications for this app... so not really relevant. content: We cannot know what your phone's settings are, but they need to be IMAP if you want to be in sync with IMAP on PC.. Your other question was answered in a separate thread.
creator: davidsk

content: First, you cannot change an existing account setup; you must create a separate IMAP account. No, you will not lose any messages. However, all previously downloaded messages that were removed from the server need to be copied to Local Folders; otherwise, you will lose those messages when you close the account.

content:
Norton is a common source of blockages, which is why it's suggested to run Windows in safe mode, or remove Norton (disabling it is not sufficient).

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1485137
creator: sfhowes

content: I looked at the question the link took me to. The user said their problem affected their Gmail accounts and posted a screenshot of a dialog box about certificates when sending encrypted emails. I get no dialog boxes, notices, alerts, etc. Just what's in the lower left corner of the pane. Every ten minutes when TB checks my accounts for new messages, the status messages are displayed in the lower left of the TB pane. For Mailfence only, it will say "connected to imap.mailfence.com..." and it stays there for about five seconds and then disappears. No error messages , boxes, etc.
creator: larrycrites

content:
Larry Crites said

creator: larrycrites

content: Quite perplexing. And I wasn't aware of Larry's history but when I searched for mailfence problems https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1450842 is among the first to come up. And in that issue, it looks like for unknown reasons it solved itself?
creator: wsmwk

content: In that instance, TB broke after an update. After many attempts to repair, I removed TB and went back to an older version. After numerous restarts for updates it got back to the latest version and worked. In this instance, Outlook and Gmail accounts connect normally. Only the connection to Mailfence stalls. It will not login. Connection History at Mailfence shows a valid connection, but doesn't show from what. I know it's TB , because one connection is DAV, the address book. After reverting to a previous version of TB, uninstalling a Windows update, that happened right before this started, and checking the configuration for Mailfence at least 15 times, I am checking with Mailfence to see if it's on their end. I knew Norton was NEVER the problem, but I humored the arrogant Moderator, and now it's cost Thunderbird a longtime user/donor. Sorry.
creator: larrycrites

content:
You forgot to mention that in troubleshoot mode The default toolbar layout is used. See https://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_Mode 

   Safe Mode temporarily affects the following: 
   • All extensions are disabled.    • The default theme is used, without a persona.    • The Just-in-time (JIT) JavaScript compiler is disabled.    • The userChrome.css and userContent.css files are ignored.    • The default toolbar layout is used.    • Hardware acceleration is disabled.


That means that if e. g. you have activated the "Quick Filter" toolbar to display only unread messages and if you also activated the the pin icon "Keep filters applied when switching folders", you will only see unread messages in folders or none if they don't contain unread. (see picture) Now when you start TB in troubleshoot mode your filters will be disabled and you can see ALL your messages again.
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Thanks for that suggestion, but I haven't actually been using the "quick filter" feature. In fact I couldn't see your message in Thunderbird, only when I log on to the fastmail server. And Thunderbird does show me some of the messages which I have already read; reading a message doesn't seem to affect its visibility.

For some senders I get all messages, for some none (they appear only on the server). So far I have found no senders for whom some messages appear and others don't. It seems that Thunderbird displays only messages from senders who are in my address book. Might there be a setting somewhere to fix this?

You also note that troubleshooting mode uses the default theme. Looking at themes, I am using the system theme labeled as "auto." "Light" and "dark" themes are also offered, and I tried each with no effect on which messages are visible. As for the other items -- 

  • The Just-in-time (JIT) JavaScript compiler is disabled.   • The userChrome.css and userContent.css files are ignored.   • The default toolbar layout is used. --

I do not know how to set the first two, and would appreciate knowing how to verify that the the "default toolbar layout" is what I am using now. Thanks again for taking the time to look at this.
creator: taxpayer

content: SOLVED! This problem is addressed at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1502925 It does seem like a suboptimal user interface, that the user can so easily do this unintentionally.
creator: taxpayer

content: 1. You can't manually enable/disable JIT 2. If you haven't created userChrome/userContent.css, you don't have them anyway 3. The default toolbar has nothing on it except a very large search box at the top of the page 4. There is no specific setting in Thunderbird for displaying only messages from senders who are in your address book. One way to accomplish it would be with filters. Have you made any?
creator: siffemoz

content:
taxpayer said
For some senders I get all messages, for some none (they appear only on the server). So far I have found no senders for whom some messages appear and others don't. It seems that Thunderbird displays only messages from senders who are in my address book. Might there be a setting somewhere to fix this?

Your problem can be explained by an activation of the button "Show only messages from people in your address book" in the "Quick Filter" toolbar (see my picture)
creator: Mapenzi

content:
taxpayer said
SOLVED! This problem is addressed at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1502925 It does seem like a suboptimal user interface, that the user can so easily do this unintentionally.

You may have noticed that the solution in the linked question is MY solution. And yes, many people activate this Quick filter toolbar unintentionally which means that the UI is suboptimal ....

Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate

creator: @next

content:
Grazie molte per la risposta !

Sì, riesco ad avviarlo nelle due modalità, sempre stesso errore

Ultima versione di Thunderbird SO. W11

Provider: Libero e Aruba Account: 3 IMAP + 1 POP3 Nessuna estensione

Errore: " TB non risponde attendi o riavvia" Antivir. AVIRA (disattivato, ma nulla)

Note: azioni precedenti il crash ignoto: -aggiornamento W11 (testato in modalità provv. nulla) - passaggio da LAN radio a Starlink; in quest'ultimo TB non inviava ne riceveva, contattato l'assistenza chiedendo se sussistevano problemi di incompatibilità, dopo 2 gg. TB scaricava e inviava. Dopo altri 2 giorni il crash, non rimane operativo per più di 1 minuto. Penso vi sia qualcosa all'interno delle cartelle profilo che si trascina dietro dopo le varie re-installazioni. In particolare: se utilizzo-cerco di aprire un account in particolare per leggere la posta, si blocca subito-immediatamente nn appena con il cursore lo seleziono ! Mentre apro e leggo gli altri 3, ma SOLO per non più di un minuto circa, dopo tale termine si blocca allo stesso modo.

Ora provo con altro sistema: disinstallo e opero da nuovo utente e cioè a NON inserire la cartella di Backup "profilo" e vediamo se va ancora in blocco, se non lo fa penso sia certo che c'è qualcosa (o manca) all'interno della cartella "profilo" e cioè quella che uso per il ripristino e/o backup

Grazie ancora per la risposta

s
creator: sz32

content:
Probabilmente hai ragione, potrebbe essersi danneggiato qualche file del profilo.

Per il test che vorresti fare, non c'è bisogno di disinstallare ti basta creare un nuovo profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-piu-profili#w_creare-un-profilo

In alternativa si può provare a riconfigurare da zero gli account e poi importare solo la posta dal vecchio profilo.
creator: @next

content:
Ok, provo con un nuovo profilo

Nel caso riscontrassi lo stesso problema eseguo la seconda proposta, in quale cartella trovo la posta dei 4 account ?

Ti ringrazio ancora e auguro un buon fine settimana

Saluti

s
